```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
wavelength <- sample(10:99, 1) # m
speed <- sample(10:99, 1) # m/s
  
ans <- signif(wavelength / speed, 3) # freq (Hz)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 6)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{s}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```
Question
========
A wave is travelling at $`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}$ with a wavelength of $`r fmt(wavelength, 1)` \,\mathsf{m}$. 
What is its period?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Since $f = 1/ T$, period is related to wavelength and speed by $v = f \lambda = \lambda/T$. 
Therefore, we have

$$ T = \frac{\lambda}{v} = \frac{`r wavelength` \,\mathsf{m}}{`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{s}$$
